description: standing figure of Christ wearing a white loincloth and crown of thorns, tied to a short column; figure at left with arm poised to lash Christ with thongs; figure at left wears salmon-colored skirt and white headband and partially-removed shirt; three figures at right, including turbaned man with long beard wearing salmon-colored robes; very dark ground
markings: on back of frame and stretcher: two Santa Barbara Museum of Art loan labels
title: Flagellation of Christ
